source_sentence: 貞觀十九年春正月景子，京城留守左僕射梁國公房玄齡等承法師齎經、像至，乃遣右武侯大將軍侯莫陳寔、雍州司馬李叔眘、長安縣令李乾祐等奉迎，自漕而入，舍於都亭驛，其從若雲。
translation: In the first month of the spring of the nineteenth year of Zongguan, Prince Fang Xuanling, the left servant of the capital, accepted the arrival of the Dharma teacher with the sūtras and images, and sent Chen Shi, the right military commander, General Junhou, Li Shuxuan, the director of Yongzhou, and Li Qianyou, the mayor of Chang'an, to welcome them from the canal and enter the city.

source_sentence: 是日有司頒諸寺，具帳輿、花幡等，擬送經、像于弘福寺，人皆欣踊，各競莊嚴。
translation: On that day, the authorities ordered the temples to send sūtras and images to Hongfusi with marching banners and flower banners, and the people were enthusiastic and each competed with the others in adornment.

source_sentence: 翌日大會於朱雀街之南，凡數百件，部伍陳列。
translation: The following day, the great assembly was held south of Vermilion Bird Street, and hundreds of items were arranged in rows.

source_sentence: 即以安置法師於西域所得如來肉舍利一百五十粒；摩揭陀國前正覺山龍窟留影金佛像一軀，通光座高三尺三寸；擬婆羅痆斯國鹿野苑初轉法輪像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高三尺五寸；擬憍賞彌國出愛王思慕如來刻檀寫真像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高二尺九寸；擬劫比他國如來自天宮下降寶階像，銀佛像一軀，通光座高四尺；擬摩揭陀國鷲峯山說《法花》等經像，金佛像一軀，通光座高三尺五寸；擬那揭羅曷國伏毒龍所留影像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高尺有五寸；擬吠舍釐國巡城行化，刻檀像等。
translation: 即以安置法師於西域所得如來肉舍利一百五十粒；摩揭陀國前正覺山龍窟留影金佛像一軀，通光座高三尺三寸；擬婆羅痆斯國鹿野苑初轉法輪像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高三尺五寸；擬憍賞彌國出愛王思慕如來刻檀寫真像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高二尺九寸；擬劫比他國如來自天宮下降寶階像，銀佛像一軀，通光座高四尺；擬摩揭陀國鷲峯山說《法花》等經像，金佛像一軀，通光座高三尺五寸；擬那揭羅曷國伏毒龍所留影像，刻檀佛像一軀，通光座高尺有五寸；擬吠舍釐國巡城行化，刻檀像等。

source_sentence: 又安置法師於西域所得大乘經二百二十四部，大乘論一百九十二部，上座部經、律、論一十五部，大眾部經、律、論一十五部，三彌底部經、律、論一十五部，彌沙塞部經、律、論二十二部，迦葉臂耶部經、律、論一十七部，法密部經、律、論四十二部，說一切有部經、律、論六十七部，因論三十六部，聲論一十三部，凡五百二十夾，六百五十七部，以二十匹馬負而至。
translation: He also installed two hundred and twenty-four great vehicle scriptures, one hundred and ninety-two great vehicle treatises, fifteen scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Theravada school, fifteen scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Mahāyāna school, fifteen scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Saṃmitīya school, twenty-two scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Mahīśāsaka school, one hundred and seventeen scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Kāśyapīya school, forty-two scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Dharmôttarīya school, sixty-seven scriptures, vinaya, and treatises of the Saṃkhya school, thirty-six treatises of the Saṃkhya school, and one hundred and fifty-seven treatises of the śrāvaka school, all five hundred and twenty folders, which were carried on twenty horses.

source_sentence: 其日所司普班諸寺，但有寶帳、幢、幡供養之具，限明二十八日旦並集朱雀街擬迎新至經、像於弘福寺。
translation: On that day, the temple superintendent, who had nothing but jeweled canopies, banners, and banners to offer, gathered at Vermilion Bird Street on the first day of the 28th day of the bright sun in order to welcome the newly arrived scriptures and images to Hongfusi.

source_sentence: 於是人增勇銳，各競莊嚴，窮諸麗好，幢帳、幡蓋寶案、寶輿，寺別將出分布訖，僧尼等整服隨之，雅梵居前，薰爐列後，至是並陳於街內，凡數百事。
translation: Thereupon, the people increased in courage, each competed in adornment, various beautiful features were exhausted, banners, pennants, and banners covered with jeweled seats and mounts were distributed separately by the temple, followed by the monks and nuns in full dress, with the elegant priests in front and the perfumed censer at the back, and they were displayed in the street in hundreds of ways.

source_sentence: 布經、像而行，珠珮動音，金花散彩，預送之儔莫不歌詠希有，忘塵遣累，歎其希遇。
translation: When the scriptures and statues were spread out and carried, the pearls and trinkets moved and the gold flowers scattered colors, and the audience that had been sent off sang songs about the rare and precious things, forgot about the dust and got rid of their burdens, and admired their rare encounter.

source_sentence: 始自朱雀街內，終屆弘福寺門，數十里間，都人仕子、內外官僚列道兩傍，瞻仰而立，人物闐[門@壹]，所司恐相騰踐，各令當處燒香散花，無得移動，而煙雲讚響，處處連合。
translation: For dozens of miles from the beginning of Vermilion Bird Street to the end of Hongfusi Gate, the city's people, retainers, and internal and external officials lined up on both sides of the road, standing in awe and admiration, and the people were all over the [gate@one], and the superintendent was afraid of trampling on each other, so he had each place burn incense and scatter flowers without being able to move, while the smoke and clouds of praise were heard everywhere.

source_sentence: 昔如來創降迦毘，彌勒初昇覩史，龍神供養，天眾圍遶，雖不及彼時，亦遺法之盛也。
translation: In the past, when the Tathāgata first descended to Kapila and Maitreya first rose to see him, the dragons and gods made offerings to him, and the gods surrounded him, even though it wasn't as great as that time, it was still a legacy of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 其日眾人同見天有五色綺雲現於日北，宛轉當經、像之上，紛紛郁郁，周圓數里，若迎若送，至寺而微。
translation: On that day, everyone saw a five-colored, elegant cloud appear in the sky to the north of the sun, and it was in a continuous stream above the sūtras and images, for miles around, welcoming and sending them to the temple and then fading away.

source_sentence: 釋彥悰箋述曰：「余考尋圖史，此蓋謂天之喜氣，識者嘉焉。
translation: Śāriputra commented, "I have searched through the history of pictures, and this is called the joyful energy of the gods, which is commendable to those who know it.

source_sentence: 昔如來創降迦維，慈氏將昇覩史，龍神供養，天眾奉迎，雖不及往時，而遺法東流，未有若茲之盛也。」
translation: When the Tathāgata first descended to Kapilavastu and the Ci family was about to ascend to Tuṣita, the dragons and gods made offerings and the gods welcomed them, although it was not as great as in the past, the legacy of the Dharma flowing eastward had never been as great as this."

source_sentence: 壬辰，法師謁　文武聖皇帝於洛陽宮。
translation: In the year 2012, the teacher of the Dharma was present at the palace of Emperor Wenwusheng in Luoyang.

source_sentence: 二月己亥，見於儀鸞殿，帝迎慰甚厚。
translation: In the second month of the year, he met at Rilan Hall, where the emperor welcomed him with open arms.

source_sentence: 既而坐訖，　帝曰：「師去何不相報？」
translation: When he had finished sitting, the emperor said, "Why didn't you tell him you were leaving?"

source_sentence: 法師謝曰：「玄奘當去之時，以再三表奏，但誠願微淺，不蒙允許。
translation: The teacher thanked him, "When Xuanzang was leaving, I had repeatedly expressed my wish, but my sincerity was shallow and I wasn't allowed to go.

source_sentence: 無任慕道之至，乃輒私行，專擅之罪，唯深慚懼。」
translation: I don't think I could have admired the Way so much that I would have gone off on my own, but I'm deeply ashamed of the crime of trespassing."

source_sentence: 帝曰：「師出家與俗殊隔，然能委命求法，惠利蒼生。
translation: The emperor said, "Even though he left home and was far removed from the lay world, he was able to commit himself to seeking the Dharma and benefiting the common people.

source_sentence: 朕甚嘉焉，亦不煩為愧。
translation: I'm very impressed, and I don't need to be ashamed.

source_sentence: 但念彼山川阻遠，方俗異心，怪師能達也。」
translation: But I'm just mindful that those mountains and rivers are so remote, and that people in different directions and customs have different minds, so I'm surprised that the teacher was able to reach them."

source_sentence: 法師對曰：「玄奘聞乘疾風者，造天池而非遠；御龍舟者，涉江波而不難。
translation: The teacher replied, "Xuanzang has heard that a swift breeze makes it possible for someone to travel to Tianchi without being far away, and that a dragon boat makes it possible for someone to wade through rivers and waves without difficulty.

source_sentence: 自陛下握乾符，清四海，德籠九域，仁被八區，淳風扇炎景之南，　聖威振葱山之外，所以戎夷君長，每見雲翔之鳥自東來者，猶疑發於上國，斂躬而敬之，況玄奘圓首方足，親承育化者也。
translation: Since Your Majesty assumed control of the Gan Fu and cleared the four seas, Your virtue encompassed nine regions, Your benevolence was extended to eight areas, and Your simple fans were south of Yanjing and Your divine authority was vibrant beyond Niang Shan, so whenever the rulers of the barbarians saw a bird flying in the clouds coming from the east, they still suspected that it had arisen in a higher country and recited their respect.

source_sentence: 既賴　天威，故得往還無難。」
translation: Relying on the authority of Heaven, he was able to go back and forth without difficulty."

source_sentence: 帝曰：「此自是師長者之言，　朕何敢當也。」
translation: The emperor said, "These are the words of a senior teacher, so how dare I accept them?"

source_sentence: 因廣問彼事。
translation: He then asked him about them in detail.

source_sentence: 自雪嶺已西，印度之境，玉燭和氣，物產風俗，八王故迹，四佛遺蹤，並博望之所不傳，班、馬無得而載。
translation: From the snowy peaks onward and westward, the realm of India has a harmonious jade candle, products and customs, the former traces of the eight kings, and the remains of the four buddhas, which were not transmitted by Bomang and which Ban and Ma could not have recorded.

source_sentence: 法師既親遊其地，觀覿疆邑，耳聞目覽，記憶無遺，隨問詶對，皆有條理。
translation: After visiting the region and observing the city, the teacher had heard by ear and eye, and had no failures of memory.

source_sentence: 帝大悅，謂侍臣曰：「昔符堅稱釋道安為神器，舉朝尊之。
translation: The emperor was greatly pleased and told his attendants, "In the past, Fu Jian called Shi Dao'an a sacred weapon and held him in high esteem in the court.

source_sentence: 朕今觀法師詞論典雅，風節貞峻，非唯不愧古人，亦乃出之更遠。」
translation: Now, as I observe, the teacher's elegant discourse and chaste manners not only live up to those of the past, but also surpass them even further."

source_sentence: 時趙國公長孫無忌對曰：「誠如　聖旨。
translation: The then Duke of Zhao, Changsun Wuji, replied, "It's true, it's the wish of the emperor.

source_sentence: 臣嘗讀《晉國春秋》，見敘安事，實是高行博物之僧。
translation: I've read the Jin Spring and Autumn Annals and seen that Xuan's work was really that of a highly practiced and knowledgeable monk.

source_sentence: 但彼時佛法來近，經、論未多，雖有鑽研，蓋其條葉，非如法師躬窺淨域，討眾妙之源，究泥洹之跡者矣。」
translation: But at the time, the Buddha's teachings had come so recently that there weren't many scriptures or treatises, and even though they had been studied, their leaves were not as detailed as those of the teacher who had personally peered into the pure land, discussed the many wonderful sources, and investigated the traces of nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 帝曰：「公言是也。」
translation: The emperor said, "You've said it."

source_sentence: 帝又謂法師曰：「佛國遐遠，靈跡法教，前史不能委詳，師既親覩，宜修一傳，以示未聞。」
translation: The emperor also said to the teacher of the Dharma, "The Buddha country is far away, and its spiritual traces and Dharma teachings cannot be detailed in previous history.

source_sentence: 帝又察法師堪公輔之寄，因勸歸俗，助秉俗務。
translation: The emperor also noticed that the teacher of the Dharma was a worthy successor to the government, so he encouraged him to return to secular life and assist in secular duties.

source_sentence: 法師謝曰：「玄奘少踐緇門，伏膺佛道，玄宗是習，孔教未聞。
translation: The teacher thanked him, "Xuanzang was a junior practitioner of the black and white teachings, and he had devoted himself to the Buddha's way, which was practiced by the Xuanzong school and not heard of by the Confucian teaching.

source_sentence: 今遣從俗，無異乘流之舟使棄水而就陸，不唯無功，亦徒令腐敗也。
translation: If I were to be sent back to the secular world, it would be like abandoning a boat that's riding a current and going to land; not only would it be useless, it would only lead to decay.

source_sentence: 願得畢身行道，以報國恩，即玄奘之幸甚。」
translation: It would be a great blessing for Xuanzang if he could finish his life and practice the path in order to repay the country's kindness."

source_sentence: 如是固辭乃止。
translation: He thus resolutely refused and stopped.

source_sentence: 時　帝將問罪遼濱，天下之兵已會於洛，軍事忙迫，聞法師至，令引入朝，期暫相見，而清言既交，遂不知日昃。
translation: When the emperor was about to question the Liaobin, the world's troops had already met at Luo, and military affairs were pressing, he heard that the Dharma teacher had arrived and ordered him to come into the court, expecting to see him momentarily.

source_sentence: 趙國公長孫無忌奏稱法師停在鴻臚，日暮恐不及。
translation: The Duke of Zhao, Changsun Wuji, reported that the teacher of the Dharma had stopped at Hongluo and was afraid that he would not be able to make it at sunset.

source_sentence: 帝曰：「怱怱言猶未盡意，欲共師東行省方觀俗，指麾之外，別更談敘，師意如何？」
translation: The emperor said, "I'm afraid I haven't exhausted my senses in hurried speech, so I'd like to travel east with the teacher to observe the secular world and talk about something other than pointing the finger at him.

source_sentence: 法師謝稱：「玄奘遠來，兼有疾疹，恐不堪陪駕。」
translation: The teacher thanked him, saying, "Xuanzang has come a long way, and I'm afraid I have a disease and rash that would prevent me from accompanying him."

source_sentence: 帝曰：「師尚能孤遊絕域，今此行蓋同跬步，安足辭焉？」
translation: The emperor said, "The teacher was still able to travel alone to a desolate region; now that he's taken the same step, how can he afford to resign?"

source_sentence: 法師對曰：「　陛下東征，六軍奉衛，罰亂國，誅賊臣，必有牧野之功，昆陽之捷。
translation: The teacher of the Dharma said, "Your Majesty's eastern expedition, with six armies defending you, punishing disorderly states and punishing traitorous ministers, will surely result in the success of Muyang and the victory of Kunyang.

source_sentence: 玄奘自度，終無裨助行陣之效，虛負途路費損之慚。
translation: Even so, Xuanzang's self-imposed judgment will not be effective in helping him to advance to battle and will be in vain because of the expense of traveling.

source_sentence: 加以兵戎戰鬪，律制不得觀看。
translation: Moreover, when it comes to military combat, it's impossible to observe the rules and regulations.

source_sentence: 既佛有此言，不敢不奉。
translation: Now that the Buddha has given this advice, I dare not refuse to give it.

source_sentence: 伏願天慈哀矜，即玄奘幸甚。」
translation: I hope that God will have mercy on him, for it is fortunate for Xuanzang."

source_sentence: 帝信納而止。
translation: The emperor was convinced and stopped.

source_sentence: 法師又奏云：「玄奘從西域所得梵本六百餘部，一言未譯。
translation: The teacher also reported, "Xuanzang has obtained more than six hundred Sanskrit texts from the western regions, but he has not translated a single one.

source_sentence: 今知此嵩岳之南、少室山北有少林寺，遠離壥落，泉石清閑，是後魏孝文皇帝所造，即菩提留支三藏翻譯經處。
translation: Now, we know that south of Mt. Songyue and north of Mt. Shaosi there is Shaolin Temple, which is far removed from the city and has clear springs and rocks, and was built by Emperor Xiaowen of the late Wei Dynasty as a place for the Bodhirucian Tripiṭaka to translate the scriptures.

source_sentence: 玄奘望為國就彼翻譯，伏聽　勅旨。」
translation: Xuanzang wishes to translate there for his country, and I await your order."

source_sentence: 帝曰：「不須在山，師西方去後，朕奉為　穆太后於西京造弘福寺，寺有禪院甚虛靜，法師可就翻譯。」
translation: The emperor said, "It's not necessary to stay at the mountain; after the teacher's departure to the west, I will allow Empress Mu to build the Hongfu Temple in Xijings, which has a meditation hall that's quite quiet, so the teacher can translate there."

source_sentence: 法師又奏曰：「百姓無知，見玄奘從西方來，妄相觀看，遂成闤闠，非直違觸憲網，亦為妨廢法事，望得守門以防諸過。」
translation: The teacher also said, "The people are ignorant, and when they see Xuanzang coming from the West, they deludedly observe and watch him, thus creating a crowd.

source_sentence: 帝大悅曰：「師此意可謂保身之言也，當為處分。
translation: The emperor was greatly pleased, saying, "This idea of the teacher's can be regarded as words to protect one's body, and it should be taken care of.

source_sentence: 師可三五日停憇，還京就弘福安置。
translation: The teacher may stop for three or five days, return to the capital, and settle in Hongfu.

source_sentence: 諸有所須，一共玄齡平章。」
translation: If there's anything you need, you can contact Xuanling Pingzhang."

source_sentence: 自是辭還矣。
translation: He then resigned and returned.

source_sentence: 三月己巳，法師自洛陽還至長安，即居弘福寺。
translation: In the third month, Jisi, the teacher returned from Luoyang to Chang'an and stayed at Hongfusi.

source_sentence: 將事翻譯，乃條疏所須證義、綴文、筆受、書手等數，以申留守司空梁國公玄齡，玄齡遣所司具狀發使定州啟　奏。
translation: After translating his order, he submitted a list of the necessary documents, textual attachments, writing implements, and calligraphers to Xuanling, the minister of Liang, who sent a commission to Dingzhou to present the case in writing.

source_sentence: 令旨依所須供給，務使周備。
translation: He ordered that the necessary offerings be made in accordance with the order, and that they be made complete.

source_sentence: 夏六月戊戌，證義大德諳解大小乘經、論為時輩所推者，一十二人至，即京弘福寺沙門靈潤、沙門文備，羅漢寺沙門慧貴，實際寺沙門明琰，寶昌寺沙門法祥，靜法寺沙門普賢，法海寺沙門神昉，廓州法講寺沙門道深，汴州演覺寺沙門玄忠，蒲州普救寺沙門神泰，綿州振嚮寺沙門敬明，益州多寶寺沙門道因等。

source_sentence: 陛下經緯八宏之略，驅駕英豪之才，剋定禍亂之功，崇闡雍熙之業，聰明文思之德，體元合極之姿，皆天之所授，無假於人，其義一也。
translation: Your Majesty's scriptures and eight broad strategies, your ability to drive heroes and heroines, your success in staunching misfortune and chaos, your success in expounding the karma of Yongxi, your intelligence, your virtue in writing and thinking, and your gesture of combining the essentials are all given by heaven without any false pretenses from humans.

source_sentence: 敦本棄末，尚仁尚禮，移澆風於季俗，反淳政於上皇，賦遵薄制，刑用輕典，九州四海稟識懷生，俱沐恩波，咸遂安樂，此又　聖心至化，無假於人，其義二也。
translation: To dwell on the fundamentals and abandon the derivatives, to promote kindness and propriety, to transfer the outgoing winds to the custom of the age, to oppose the simple government of the emperor, to follow thin rules for taxation, and to use lighter penalties, so that all the consciousnesses in Kyushu and the four seas and the living beings are showered with grace and waves, and all are made comfortable, is another example of the supreme transformation of the noble mind, which is not contingent on humans, and which has two meanings.

source_sentence: 至道旁通，深仁遠洽，東逾日域，西邁崑丘，南盡炎洲，北窮玄塞，彫蹄鼻飲之俗，卉服左衽之人，莫不候雨瞻風，稽顙屈膝，獻珍貢寶，充委夷邸，此又天威所感，無假於人，其義三也。
translation: When the supreme way is paralleled and profound benevolence is far-reaching, the eastern regions exceed the Sun, the western regions go to Kunqiu, the southern regions end at Yanzhou, and the northern regions end at Xuanzai, and the customs of sculpted hooves and noses and the people in floral robes and left obeisance all await the rain and wind, bow at the knees, offer treasures and tributes, and fill the barbarians' homes with them, this is another example of the power of heaven being touched without false pretences, which has a third meaning.

source_sentence: 獫狁為患，其來自久，五帝所不臣，三王不能制，遂使河、洛為被髮之野，酆、鄗為鳴鏑之場，中國陵遲，凶奴得志，殷周已來不能攘弭。

translation: When Han Wu ran out of troops, Wei and Huo did their best, but although they gathered branches and leaves, their roots still remained.

translation: Since then, no good strategy has been heard.

translation: Now, Your Majesty has made a plan to eliminate them all in one expedition, leaving no nest or cave remaining, incorporating the domains of Xuanhai and Yanran into Tifeng, and giving all the men of Shangyu's archery to my ministers.

source_sentence: 故知有道斯得，無假於人，其義四也。
translation: Therefore, it's known that there's a way to attain it, and there's no falsehood in it, which has four meanings.

source_sentence: 高麗小蕃，失禮上國，隋帝總天下之師，三自征罰，攻城無傷半堞，野掠不獲一人，虛喪六軍，狼狽而反。
translation: The Xiaofan of Goryeo had dishonored the kingdom, but the Sui emperor, who had commanded the whole world's army, had conquered and punished it three times without harming half of the battlements, without capturing a single person in the wilderness, and had lost six armies in vain and turned back in confusion.

source_sentence: 陛下暫行，將數萬騎，摧駐蹕之強陣，破遼、蓋之堅城，振旅凱旋，俘[酋*或]三十萬眾。
translation: His Majesty took a short trip, generating tens of thousands of horses, destroying the strong garrison of Royce, breaking through the strong cities of Lia and Gai, invigorating his troops in triumph, and capturing [sheiks*or] 300,000 people.

source_sentence: 用兵御將，其道不殊，隋以之亡，唐以之得，故知由主，無假於人，其義五也。
translation: The way in which the Sui Dynasty fell because of this and the Tang Dynasty gained because of this, so it's known that it's up to the lord and not to leave it to others, which is also the fifth meaning.

source_sentence: 又如天地交泰，日月光華，和氣氤氳，慶雲紛郁，五靈見質，一角呈奇，白狼、白狐、朱鸞、朱草、昭彰雜沓，無量億千，不能遍舉，皆是應德而至，無假於人。
translation: It's also like when heaven and earth intermingle, the sun and moon shine, harmonious air is mysterious, clouds of joy abound, five spirits see quality, a single horn presents itself, and white wolves, white foxes, vermilion luan, vermilion grass, and a multitude of measureless millions cannot be imagined, all arriving in response to virtue without being falsely attributed to humans.

source_sentence: 乃欲比喻前王，寄功十亂，竊為　陛下不取。

source_sentence: 縱復須人，今亦伊、呂多矣。
translation: Even if it were necessary to have someone, there are now more than enough of them in Yi and Lu.

translation: How could Xuanzang, a mediocre man, have predicted them?

source_sentence: 帝甚悅。

source_sentence: 謂法師曰：「師向所陳，並上玄垂祐，及宗廟之靈，卿士之力，朕安能致也。

source_sentence: 既欲敷揚妙道，亦不違高志，可努力，今日已後亦當助師弘道。」
translation: Since you want to spread the wondrous way and don't disagree with your high intention, you can work hard and help the teacher to spread the way after today."

source_sentence: 釋彥悰箋曰：「法師才兼內外，臨機酬答，其辯洽如是，難哉！
translation: Śākyamuni said, "The teacher is a man of both internal and external ability, and when he meets the opportunity to respond, his eloquence is like this.

source_sentence: 昔道安陳諫，符堅之駕不停，恒標奮辭，姚興之心莫止，終致敗軍之辱，逃遁之勞。
translation: In the past, when Dao An offered advice, Fu Jian's carriage didn't stop, and when Heng Biao resigned, Yao Xing's heart didn't stop, which eventually led to the humiliation of losing the army and the trouble of fleeing.

source_sentence: 豈如法師雅論纔申，　皇情允塞，清風轉潔，美志踰貞。
translation: Is it not like the teacher Fashi, whose elegant discourse was only recently expressed, whose imperial sentiments were freely accepted, whose clear breeze was transformed into purity, and whose beautiful intentions were overtaken by modesty?

source_sentence: 以此而言，可不煩月且而優劣見矣。」
translation: In this way, you can see the superiority and inferiority of such a person without bothering about months and years."

translation: Chu Suiliang, the then-middle minister, replied, "Now, the four seas are clear and the nine regions are peaceful, all because of Your Majesty's noble virtue, just as the teacher said, and we ministers are just preparing for our positions.

translation: He answered, "I've recently published the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra, which consists of a hundred volumes."

translation: The emperor said, "This treatise is very large; why did the sages teach it?

source_sentence: 答曰：「論是彌勒菩薩說，明十七地義。」
translation: He answered, "This is the Maitreya-bodhisattva's explanation of the meaning of the seventeen stages."

translation: Again, he asked, "What's the name of the seventeen stages?"

source_sentence: 答：「謂五識相應地，意識相應地，有尋有伺地，無尋唯伺地，無尋無伺地，三摩呬多地，非三摩呬多地，有心地，無心地，聞所成地，思所成地，修所成地，聲聞地，獨覺地，菩薩地，有餘依地，無餘依地。」
translation: Answer: "They are the stage associated with the five consciousnesses, the stage associated with consciousness, the stage with seeking and probing, the stage without seeking but probing, the stage without seeking or probing, the stage with and without samākritu, the stage with and without mind, the stage formed by hearing, the stage formed by thinking, the stage formed by cultivating, the stage of the direct disciples, the stage of the solitary realizers, the stage of the bodhisattvas, the stage with and without residue."

source_sentence: 及舉綱提目，陳列大義。

translation: Ima was told that the secretary of the department of Kan and the secretary of the province would write nine copies of the newly translated scriptures and treatises, which were circulated in nine states, including Yong, Luo, Bing, Yan, Xiang, Jing, Yang, Liang, and Yi, so that the people of those lands would share the same inheritance of the unheard-of teachings.

source_sentence: 時司徒趙公長孫無忌、中書令褚遂良等奏曰：「臣聞佛教沖玄，天人莫測，言本則甚深，語門則難入。
translation: The then secretary-gong Zhao Chang Sun Wuji and the secretary-general Chu Suilang submitted, "I've heard that Buddhism is vast and unfathomable to gods and humans, and that the fundamentals are profound in speech and difficult to enter in the gate of language.

source_sentence: 伏惟　陛下至道昭明，飛光昱日，澤霑遐界，化溢中區，擁護五乘，建立三寶，故得法師當叔葉而秀質，間千載而挺生，陟重阻以求經，履危途而訪道。
translation: Fortunately, Your Majesty's supreme way is clear and bright, its light soars brightly, its swamp covers far and wide, its teachings overflow the middle region, it embraces the five vehicles, and it establishes the Three Treasures, so it's possible for a teacher of the Dharma to be like Shu Ye and his quality is outstanding, and he's been alive for a thousand years, rising above heavy obstacles to seek out the scriptures and following dangerous paths to visit the way.

source_sentence: 見珍殊俗，具獲真文，歸國翻宣，若菴園之始說，精文奧義，如金口之新開，皆是陛下聖德所感。
translation: Seeing the treasures of the common people, he fully obtained the true text, returned to his country, and proclaimed it as if it had been first taught in Anāthapiṇḍada, and refined the text and its mysterious meaning as if it were the newly opened golden mouth, all because of the noble virtue of Your Majesty.

source_sentence: 臣等愚瞽，預此見聞，苦海波瀾，舟航有寄。
translation: We foolish ministers, in anticipation of what we've seen and heard here, have been sent on a voyage through the turbulent waves of the ocean of suffering.

source_sentence: 又天慈廣遠，使布之九州，蠢蠢黔黎，俱飡妙法。
translation: Furthermore, God's kindness is so vast and far-reaching that it's been disseminated throughout nine states, and foolish people everywhere receive the wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 帝居慶福殿，百官侍衛，命法師坐，使弘文舘學士上官儀以所製序對群寮宣讀，霞煥錦舒，極褒揚之致。

source_sentence: 其詞曰：「蓋聞二儀有像，顯覆載以含生，四時無形，潛寒暑以化物。
translation: His words said, "We have heard that the two genders have images that reveal the overlay and contain birth, and that the four seasons are formless and submerge in cold and heat to transform people.

source_sentence: 是以窺天鑑地，庸愚皆識其端，明陰洞陽，賢哲罕窮其數。
translation: Thus, when we peer into heaven and examine earth, both the mediocre and the foolish know their limits; when we understand yin and dawn, the wise and the philosophical rarely exhaust their numbers.

source_sentence: 然而天地包乎陰陽而易識者，以其有像也；陰陽處乎天地而難窮者，以其無形也。
translation: However, heaven and earth are encompassed by yin and yang and are easy to know because they have form; yin and yang are found in heaven and earth and are difficult to fathom because they are formless.

source_sentence: 故知象顯可徵，雖愚不惑，形潛莫覩，在智猶迷，況乎佛道崇虛，乘幽控寂，弘濟萬品，典御十方，舉威靈而無上，抑神力而無下，大之則彌於宇宙，細之則攝於毫釐，無滅無生，歷千劫而不古，若隱若顯，運百福而長今，妙道凝玄，遵之莫知其際，法流湛寂，挹之莫測其源，故知蠢蠢凡愚，區區庸鄙，投其旨趣，能無疑惑者哉。
translation: Therefore, although foolish people are not confused when they know that images are apparent and can be identified, they are still confused when their forms are hidden and unseen, especially when they know that the Buddha Way is noble and empty, rides the shadows and controls quiescence, promotes the ten thousand qualities, guides the ten directions, raises authoritative spirits that are unsurpassed, suppresses spiritual powers that are unlimited, is large enough to encompass the universe, is subtle enough to be included in the smallest detail, is without cessation or birth, has passed through a thousand eons but is not ancient, is both hidden and revealed, carries a hundred merits but is long-lasting, and is the profound subtlety of the wonderful way, the limits of which are unknown to those who follow it, and the sources of the flow of the Dharma, which are quiescent and unfathomable to those who pour it in, so it's known that foolish people and the vulgar in their own areas can cast their eyes on the goal and not have doubts.

source_sentence: 然則大教之興，基乎西土，騰漢庭而皎夢，照東域而流慈。
translation: Then the rise of the great teaching was based in the western land, rising from Han court and shining like a dream, and shining from the eastern regions and flowing with kindness.

source_sentence: 昔者分形分跡之時，言未馳而成化，當常現常之世，人仰德而知遵。
translation: In the past, when it was divided into form and traces, the words were not yet channelled into transformation, and in a time when things were permanent and presently permanent, people looked up to virtue and knew to follow it.

source_sentence: 及乎晦影歸真，遷儀越世，金容掩色，不鏡三千之光，麗像開圖，空端四八之相。
translation: When the obscure shadows returned to the truth, the changing rituals transcended the world, the golden features covered the colors, the unmirrored 3,000 lights, and the beautiful images opened the chart, revealing the four or eight characteristics of the sky.

source_sentence: 於是微言廣被，拯含類於三途，遺訓遐宣，導群生於十地。
translation: As a result, his subtle words were widely accepted, saving all sentient beings in the three paths, and his teachings were proclaimed far and wide, guiding all sentient beings in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 然而真教難仰，莫能一其旨歸，曲學易遵，邪正於焉紛糺。
translation: However, the true teaching is difficult to admire, and no one can agree on its tenet; it's easy to follow a circuitous course of study, and there's a confusion between right and wrong.

source_sentence: 所以空有之論，或習俗而是非，大小之乘，乍沿時而隆替。
translation: That's why the theories of emptiness and existence are sometimes customary but not conventional, and the greater and lesser vehicles are often changed over time.

source_sentence: 有玄奘法師者，法門之領袖也。
translation: There was the teacher Xuanzang, the leader of the Dharma school.

source_sentence: 幼懷貞敏，早悟三空之心，長契神情，先包四忍之行。
translation: He was young and chaste, realized early the three kinds of emptiness in his mind, and had a long understanding of the spiritual condition, which first encompassed the four practices of forbearance.

source_sentence: 松風水月未足比其清華，仙露明珠詎能方其朗潤，故以智通無累，神測未形，超六塵而逈出，敻千古而無對。
translation: The pine breezes, floods, and moons were not enough to compare with his clear flowers, and the immortal dew and bright pearls could in no way match his brightness; therefore, with his untainted wisdom and his unconstructed spiritual abilities, he transcended the six dust motes and rose above them, and he sailed through a thousand ages without opposition.

source_sentence: 凝心內境，悲正法之陵遲，拪慮玄門，慨深文之訛謬。
translation: He concentrates his mind on the inner realm, pities the delay of the true teaching, and unveils his thoughts on the profound approach, lamenting the fallacy of profound texts.

source_sentence: 思欲分條析理，廣彼前聞，截偽續真，開茲後學。
translation: He wanted to analyze the principle in order to expand upon what had been heard before, cut off the counterfeit and continue with the genuine, and initiate subsequent study.

source_sentence: 是以翹心淨土，往遊西域，乘危遠邁，杖策孤征。
translation: Therefore, I set my heart on the Pure Land, traveled to the Western Regions, rode a dangerous expedition, and made a lonely journey with my staff.

source_sentence: 積雪晨飛，塗間失地，驚沙夕起，空外迷天，萬里山川，撥煙霞而進影，百重寒暑，躡霜露而前蹤。
translation: Snow flies in the morning, the earth is lost between the coals, sand frightens the evening, the sky is lost beyond the sky, ten thousand miles of mountains and rivers are shaded by smoke and haze, and a hundred layers of cold and heat are traced by frost and dew.

source_sentence: 誠重勞輕，求深願達。
translation: His labor was truly heavy, but his aspirations were deep and compelling.

source_sentence: 周遊西宇，十有七年，窮歷道邦，詢求正教。
translation: He had traveled around the western regions for more than seventeen years, exhausting his travels to the countries of the Way and inquiring about the true teaching.

source_sentence: 雙林、八水，味道飡風，鹿苑、鷲峯，瞻奇仰異，承至言於先聖，受真教於上賢，探賾妙門，精窮奧業，一乘五律之道，馳驟於心田；八藏三篋之文，波濤於口海。
translation: He tasted the breezes of the twin forests and eight rivers, looked up at the wonders of the Deer Park and Vulture Peak, accepted the best words from the sages of yore, received the true teaching from the best men, explored the wondrous gate of radiotherapy, refined his mysterious activities, and rushed through the mental fields of the five paths of the One Vehicle and the eight collections and three baskets of texts, which were waves in his mouth and sea.

source_sentence: 爰自所歷之國，總將三藏要文，凡六百五十七部，譯布中夏，宣揚勝業。
translation: From the countries he visited, he compiled the Tripiṭaka's essential texts, which numbered six hundred and fifty-seven, and translated and distributed them throughout Central Xia, proclaiming their excellent work.

source_sentence: 引慈雲於西極，注法雨於東垂，聖教缺而復全，蒼生罪而還福，濕火宅之乾焰，共拔迷途，朗愛水之昏波，同臻彼岸。
translation: By drawing clouds of kindness to the western pole and pouring Dharma rain to the east, the holy teaching was made whole despite its shortcomings, the sins of ordinary people were returned to their merits, the dry flames of burning houses were jointly removed from the misleading path, and the dim waves of the waters of love were clarified to reach the other shore together.

source_sentence: 是知惡因業墜，善以緣昇，昇墜之端，唯人所託。
translation: This is how you know that bad causes fall from karma, good rises by conditions, and the only thing that rises and falls is the trust of people.

source_sentence: 譬夫桂生高嶺，雲露方得泫其華；蓮出綠波，飛塵不能污其葉。
translation: It's like a laurel growing on a high mountain where clouds and dew can only water its flowers, or a lotus emerging from a green wave where flying dust can't stain its leaves.

source_sentence: 非蓮性自潔而桂質本貞，良由所附者高則微物不能累，所憑者淨則濁類不能霑。
translation: It's not that the lotus is inherently pure and the laurel is inherently chaste; it's because the object to which it's attached is high, so tiny things can't be encumbered, and the object on which it rests is pure, so polluted things can't be caught.

source_sentence: 夫以卉木無知，猶資善而成善，況乎人倫有識，不緣慶而成慶？
translation: Even though plants and trees are ignorant, they can nurture goodness and become good, so why wouldn't humans with consciousness not depend on happiness and become happy?

source_sentence: 竊聞六爻探賾，局於生滅之場，百物正名，未涉真如之境，猶且遠徵羲冊，覩奧不測其神，遐想軒圖，歷選並歸其美。
translation: I've heard that the six hexagrams and the tantras are confined to the field of birth and death, and that the proper names of the hundred things are not yet involved in the sphere of true reality.

source_sentence: 伏惟　皇帝陛下玉毫降質，金輪御天，廓先王之九州，掩百千之日月，廣列代之區域，納恒沙之法界。
translation: I submit to Your Majesty the Emperor that the jade duster descends into the sky, the golden wheel guides the gods, contours the nine regions of the former kings, conceals the sun and moon of a hundred thousand, expands the regions of generations, and includes the Dharma realm of the constellations.

source_sentence: 遂使給園精舍並入隄封，貝葉靈文咸歸冊府。
translation: He then caused the monastery to be incorporated into the levee and the shell-leaves and spiritual texts to be returned to the registry.

source_sentence: 玄奘往因振錫，聊謁崛山，經途萬里，恃　天威如咫步，匪乘千葉，詣雙林如食頃。
translation: After traveling ten thousand miles through the scriptures, Xuanzang relied on the authority of Heaven as a stone's throw away, didn't ride on a thousand leaves, and reached Shuanglin like an instant of food.

source_sentence: 搜揚三藏，盡龍宮之所儲，研究一乘，窮鷲嶺之遺旨，並已載於白馬，還獻紫宸。
translation: He searched the Tripiṭaka, exhausted the reserves of the Dragon Palace, studied the One Vehicle, and exhausted the legacy of Vulture Peak, which he had loaded onto a white horse and returned to the purple house.

source_sentence: 尋蒙下詔，賜使翻譯。
translation: He was then instructed to send an envoy to translate the scriptures.

source_sentence: 玄奘識乖龍樹，謬忝傳燈之榮；才異馬鳴，深愧瀉瓶之敏。
translation: Xuanzang's knowledge was not like that of the dragon tree, which was a misplaced honor to transmit the Lamp; his talents were different from that of the horse's, which was a deep shame for his sensitivity in pouring out the bottle.

source_sentence: 所譯經、論紕舛尤多，遂荷　天恩，留神構序。
translation: The errors in the sūtras and treatises he translated were especially numerous, so he received a favor from Heaven and focused his attention on their construction and sequencing.

source_sentence: 文超象、繫之表，理括眾妙之門。
translation: The text transcends the surface of the elephant and the tether, and the principle encompasses the many subtle approaches.

translation: Suddenly, I was so excited and joyous to hear and receive the account of the birth of Brahmā himself that I couldn't have been more delighted.
